message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.HC 

This paper focuses on the design and implementation of a mobile measurement platform that provides full access to a device's network traffic and local context without requiring root access. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the privacy risks associated with mobile traffic, which suggests that it could also belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The paper also mentions the utility of the platform for characterizing mobile traffic, which could place it in the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the user experience of the platform, which could suggest that it belongs to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category.
